result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Dean Schottle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adam Dean Schottle is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Adam Dean Schottle was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Adam Dean Schottle was found guilty of Forgery-Writings or Objects [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Counts 1 & 3 in 15CF392 dismissed
- DE to report to probation by 4:30 p.m. on 10-17-16. Bond to remain in effect until signs up for probation. 
- Probation can be transfered to Washington County 
- Ct. 2 in 15CF392 to run concurrent to Ct. 4 in 15CF392
 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 4 in 15CF392

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be paid to DOC
$250.00 DNA Surcharge to be paid to DOC

-   DE to provide a DNA Sample
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-   Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-    It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jennifer Ann Clark, Lisa Marie Kehren & Jon Richard Stolzke.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt: Signed by DE and Atty Amann. hml

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: T. Gregory Amann, DF: Adam Dean Schottle appeared.  Court called.  Includes case 16CF341 & 15CF392.  Court and attorneys have reviewed the PSI.  ADA Nieskes makes recommendation.  Attorney Amann makes statement.  Crt orders:

Ct. 2 & Ct. 4 to run concurrent to each other
- W/S 3 years probation with conditions
- Probation can be transfered to Washington County
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-  Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- DE to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jennifer Ann Clark, Lisa Marie Kehren & Jon Richard Stolzke.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
- Court costs of $576.00 and $500 for the DNA surcharge to be paid through the DOC
- DE to report to probation by 10/17/16 by 4:30 p.m.
- DE's bail to remain in effect until the DE signs up for probation
- Court dismisses 16CF341
- 20 days to appeal

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: T Gregory Amann, DF: Adam Dean Schottle appeared.  Court called.  Set for plea/sentencing hearing.  There is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 & Ct 4.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2 & Ct. 4. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 1 & Ct. 3.  Crt orders a PSI and a COMPAS Evaluation.  SEH will be set once the PSI has been reviewed by the court.  Court adjourned.  lw
Risk Assessment (sealed). eif
Update from Agent with attachments. km

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY:  T Gregory Amann   DF:  Adam Dean Schottle appeared.  Court called at 10:48 a.m.  Set for arraignment.  Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty on all counts.  Not Guilty pleas are entered.  Speedy trial is waived.  State advises the DE has just completed inpatient treatment and will now begin a 90 day outpatient.  State wants to see the progress before making an offer.  Bail is continued.  Continue STC.  Court adjourned.  lw  Status conference scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Arraignment at 01-20-2016 10:45 am

Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Report to St. Croix County Jail every Saturday by 5:00 p.m. to update address.

Report every Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea for T Gregory Amann,  DF:  Adam Dean Schottle appeared from jail via video. Court confirms address. Court questions Defendant - he has been in custody for 4 months in Washington County on a PO hold.  ADA Nieskes is asking for $1000.00 cash bond, Atty Andrea argues. Bond continues in form and amount.   QUASH WARRANT. Defendant to report every Saturday before 5:00 p.m. to the St. Croix County Jail to report his address.  Arraignment scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 10:45 am.
